result.execSummary:
The defendant Lekecha M Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed.
Consecutive to: any other revocation sentence.

miscConds.notes: Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Absolute sobriety.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment; and or schooling.
Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Pay all court costs and supervision fees. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lekecha M Turner

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

2:44 PM Defendant Lekecha M Turner in court, in custody.  Attorney Natalie Probst in court for Lekecha M Turner.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 

Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - Ct. 2: GUILTY
State consents to jury waiver. 
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis. 
BTC: GUILTY. Ct.1 is dismissed but read in. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: 120 days Racine County Jail; imposed and stayed for 12 months of probation; consecutive to any revocation sentence.
Absolute sobriety; no controlled substances unless prescribed and must be taken as prescribed. 
Full-time employment and/or schooling. 
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA surcharge.
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: State's NOI to Intro Expert Testimony
DA Authorization to Defense to Obtain Copies of Certain Evidence

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

1:41 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lekecha M Turner appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Natalie Probst appeared by video for Lekecha M Turner. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
